summary: Siouxsie and the Banshees was a popular British rock band formed in 1976 by singer Siouxsie Sioux and bassist Steven Severin. They started with punk music but soon created a unique post-punk sound with experimental rhythms. Their debut album, "The Scream," was a big hit in 1978. Over time, the band's style changed, and they became one of the top alternative pop groups in the 1980s. They released many albums and singles, tried new things, and influenced other musicians. The band broke up in 1996, but Siouxsie continued making music with other projects.
title: Siouxsie and the Banshees
